这一作的闪轨被众人诟病，因这一作弃坑的人估计有很多，记得当时看宣传pv的时候，燃的一塌糊涂，每天不循环4到5遍就难受，很多人都以为闪轨的重头戏是帝国内战，都期望看到克州解放的场面，里爷活捉克州匪首罗伊德的场面（雾），可惜期望越大，失望也越大，结合当时视频通关的体验来说，这一作对战争的描写和刻画实在太生硬，7班和红翼的存在略显尴尬，这一作走的是碧轨终章的老套路，收集同伴，开飞机去各地，走迷宫、打BOSS，内战如儿戏，贵族联盟宛如智障...剧情注水严重，流程太短。
     作为PC玩家，直到最近才能玩到这游戏，那已经是我看过闪3的流程视频之后的事了，闪2的剧情说实话，还是有优点的，没有之前视频通关体验那么差，间章救公主、艾尔迪克被火烧、绯骑剧情、克州外传、后日谈的剧情还是不错的，还有闪3才回收的各种flag，在闪2发现这些细节的时候还是很触动的。
    战斗系统方面，在我一周目噩梦难度打下来，感觉就是不是敌人秒我就是我秒敌人，缺少了以前轨迹那种回合制RPG一来一回的乐趣，特别是幻兽太恶心了，秒放魔法无咏唱时间...敌人一放魔法我就团灭的事故经常发生，平衡性做的不如闪1，数据溢出实在太严重，各种加倍伤害的BUG级别核心回路和结晶回路，不用这些回路又很难通关...很多时候、迫不得已就只能用一波流秒掉敌人来通关。
   最后不得不说，这一作起了个疯狂使用救场套路决定角色登场方式的坏头，使得下一作闪3更加变本加厉的使用救场剧情，”その必要はない！”这句台词成为了经典救场台词，摆明了这就是在搓败玩家锐气嘛，好不容易打败了BOSS，本来很期待能看到敌人甘拜下风的剧情，就来了那么一出，反派都是在放水，主角队实力不够，过关全靠救场的莫名令人生气的剧情....借此衬托新登场的角色有多牛逼，然后加入队伍之后没牛逼多久又被救场了...我是真心讨厌用这种剧情的..给人感觉很不爽.特别对里爷来说，太苦逼了，龙傲天装逼被打断有多难受，可想而知编剧到底从多少个方面在虐里爷。。。通关ED里最心疼里爷，特别是看了闪3剧情之后，闪1 闪2 闪3 各种被虐，惨！     不喜欢主角黎恩和克洛的人，不推荐玩这一作....看视频就好，反正我个人还是能接受这一作的剧情的

40928836.review:
Story: Trails of Cold Steel is intriguing all the way through. Rean is a member of Thors, and given the knowledge we have at the beginning of the story, the goal is the graduate. Progress is made by getting good grades, making friends, and advancing the timeline. Eventually, this is extended to solving whatever mystery or crisis Class VII encounters while on your field study and getting closer to the identity of their ringleader. From the first field study, Class VII becomes entangled in a conspiracy to overthrow an ostensibly benevolent, yet ruthless dictator. Falcom skillfully weaves a documentary and exploration of late 1700's French society/late 1800's Prussian military society with a political thiller, one that gets even more intriguing as the story continues. The villains are introduced and built up from the start, and once things kick into full swing, it all about finding your friends and stopping the revolution from happening.

Gameplay: As much as we'd like to tout Kiseki's amazing writing and treat it as a visual novel that allows us to see more of the world, we must keep in mind that this is first and foremost a GAME that we play. The fact of the matter is that you will spend about 50% of your play time in traveling roads and fighting monsters. A game can have an excellent story, but that won't make up for boring, tedious, or downright frustrating gameplay. Fortunately, Trails of Cold Steel 2 is a game where I love the wandering Erebonia and fighting just as much as talking to NPCs and watching hours of cutscenes. 

40% of your playtime is spent in battle, and the vast majority of said battles are trash fights with random mobs on roads and in dungeons. It goes without saying that trash fights/random encounters are pretty boring. The saving grace of Cold Steel is that it actually managed to make even the most mundane aspects of JRPG gameplay entertaining: you have access to a wide variety of different builds, team comps, and strategies to experiment with. The game encourages you to take the time and abuse the gameplay mechanics thanks to it's XP multipliers. You never feel like you are just going through the motions. It didn't even matter that there was no real difficulty Cold Steel; it was engaging as it was.

Trails of Cold Steel benefits from being able to show off the scope of it's world and a brighter color pallete and at realistic proportions, but suffers from a limited set of stiff animations that are unable to bring out of the full potential of the story, nor be able to fully encapsulate a character's pose from how they appear in their 2D art. Understandable, since this was Falcom's first attempt at a 3D Kiseki game. That said, Falcom was still able to nail the facial features, as they are able to convey the same amount of emotion as the 2D portraits from Trails in the Sky, evoking the same sense of befuddlement, suspicion, anger, sorrow, and crazy. While their 2D art looks like something out of a contemporary A1-pictures production, the ingame models look quite unique and quite pleasing to the eye. Furthermore, I have fallen in love with science-fantasy aesthetic of Erebonia, particularly it's CS3 look which you can see traces of in CS2, such as Machias' new fold-over coat and the Crusader train. The steel grey, white, and deep blue fold over coats are quite dazzling, and that's not to mention the new architecture, orbment, and architecture! Having seen the Famitsu scans of CS3, I am absolutely hyped to experience a remodeled Erebonia!

Music: Trails of Cold Steel draws upon conteporary genres, utilizing some syntheized pieces such as my favorites "The Glint of Cold Steel", "Machinery Attack", and "Awakening". It uses rock pieces such as "Belief" and "Bring Up Trust". The few orchestral tracks it has made me swell with resolve, particularly "Courageous, Laucnh!" and "To gamble all or nothing". The quiet tracks were fantastic as well: "Wholehearted Feelings" and "To the Irreplaceable People". The mixed tracks were also great, such as "Blitzkrieg". What really took me by surprise was the extensive use of choruses in Cold Steel, with "Great Power" and "EOV" evoking the feeling of participating in some traditional saga. "Aria of the Holy Saint" is, as previously stated, one of the best pieces in the entire Kiseki series, evoking a sense of grandeur, melancholy, mystery, and heartfelt friendship during the vision scenes.

40927662.review:
The plot revolves around FRIENDSHIP POWER and is sometimes painfully forced or juvenile, the timeline doesn't make any sense, days last for well... days, several of the characters are too young to have the experiences the story claims they've had, the characters excel at the Japanese art of saying a  lot while actually saying nothing at all, the adults are super irresponsible, the frequent twists in the plot are sometimes interesting (moreso in the first game) but make you question the intelligence of the lead for missing them as they tend to be broadcasted earlier on, the combat is super exploitable (4-5 move boss fights on hard mode), the characters are super over-idealistic, the villains are very bad at their job, and no one bloody dies (IN A "WAR").

All in all, it's a typical anime in game form.  If you play it with that in mind and fast forward through most of Rean's nonsense dialogue and the "Oh, Rean"s from the rest of the cast, you should be fine.  I rather enjoyed it.  It really did feel like playing through an anime with all of its flaws and perks (harem), which is exactly what I was expecting going in.  Be prepared for every single over-used story or personality trope you could expect to make an appearance.  Also, instructor Sara is a babe and obviously the best girl.

40882047.review:
After logging in almost 90 hours, it's safe to say I couldn't put it down and the time flew by.  I got hooked.

There were a few tweaks in the gameplay and battle system, but it was largely the same, which is still very enjoyable, and the one fear I had going in, which was the Valimar fights being too bland, was quickly put to rest.  The music was once again fantastic in these fights.  Boss fights required some strategy to really maximize your character's strengths but sometimes this worked too well because of the overdrive feature having the potential to break the balance in a fight so easily.  

All the characters return, and generally are very enjoyable.  It's a given that you'll grow attached to some of them especially as you get Class VII back together, and youll have the mix of quirky and serious and fun personalities in full force, while learning more about some backstories.  This is a good thing because I think it makes up for Rean being a relatively bland protagonist, despite his special powers.  Unlike Estelle from Trails of the Sky, I think Rean's character arc is heavily dependent on everyone else supporting him and building him up, as opposed to building others up and growing on his own.  Luckily this gets masked because outside of the beginning of the game Rean is rarely left on his own unable to interact with his classmates.  

Still though, spending 90 hours without it ever feeling like a chore is all I need to say to tell you how much I enjoyed the game, although it might be a while before I work up the energy to do that again.  Hopefully 3 and 4 will be on the way!

40772043.review:
And again.. very mixed feeling.

Great:

- Characters. Most of them have a well-thought back story. Most of them feel alive and not just a pixel image. About most of them you care
- Arts are now useful!
- Scenery with local plot events. Can't say about the main story as it seems to have holes in it

Good:

- Improved navigation, better map markers
- Mostly same voicing actors for characters

Bad:

- Still same glitches when someone starts a voice line (i.e. game freezes for a second)
- Some of the battles leave you unprepared no matter what. You can't prepare in advance as some characters just randomly join and break formation and strategy
- Still bad controls on mini-games like bike riding. 

Horrificly awful:

- Devs don't learn. They still want to insist on "the game wants you to lose". Aka unwinnable battles. And what's worst is - you don't know in advance which of those are unwinnable. Apart from wasting potential resources you also waste nerves and time just to see how the boss one-shots your character or party because it's "plot event". May be there's something in it, but I hate to feel cheated. I hate to lose despite my best efforts. I hate to see consecutive lose battles. If the plot demands to lose the fight - make it a damn cutscene.

For me this point alone would make it a "not recommended" - but hey, it's just my humble opinion. The game has it's charm and benefits. I just don't get this core plot concept - i.e. why it has to be so centered around unwinnable plot events. To add to this is that even if you win the fight - the opposing characters always get away from you. They teleport, giggling and troling you, they run away under heavy fire, etc.. I.e. what is the point of fightging if you know you'll be robbed of your victory in either case?

40719501.review:
[b]The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel[/b] is the second in the "Cold Steel" trilogy of JRPGs, themselves part of the broader "Legend of Heroes" series. The third game has yet to be localized.

I highly recommend the "Cold Steel" games for all fans of (J)RPGS and engaging storytelling, something of a rarity in the formulaic genre of JRPGs. The games are distinguished by a relatable, well-drawn cast of characters (with excellent English voiceacting - watch out for Ashly Burch as Millium Orion), a challenging and deep turn-based battle system, a gripping story, and excellent replayability through NG+ and a save game transfer funcion between titles. The PC ports are outstanding, with a lot of QoL features such as a turbo mode that should be mandatory in games of this genre. 

For these games, bring a lot of time, and preferably a walkthrough if you want to discover all secrets (which is by no means necessary, though).

40700060.review:
Quality RPG that one would expect from Falcom.

Liked:
- Good continuation of the story from the (Merciless) cliffhanger of the first Cold Steel. This time, we have at least an ending that ties up the important points while leaving plenty room for continuation.

- Most characters are well developped. Really enjoy all the main character and even sub-character developments/stories, though this is nothing new to Falcom. Also great world building as usual.

- Overall good port to PC (Though bugs were frequenctly encountered: game crashes due to costumes, battle menu going unreadable, audio "delaying" Turbo mode, etc.). Good voice acting. God bless Turbo mode still ...

- Large amount of content with good replayability (Explore the oh so many character interactions and dialogues as well as the many possible battle set ups).

- Fun battle mechanics with the quick time events making the fights more engaging. 

- Good depth to the battles that pushes you to think (or just look up guides) of proper team, equipment, and quartz set ups to deal with challenging opponents. This makes the battle preparation itself a fun part of the game ... up to the point where you gain access to game breaking set ups, at which point you can waltz in on any boss knowing you will humilate them regardless of their specialties.

- Game does not force you to grind for exp or currencies as the game progresses.

Dislike: 

- Story kind of abused the "Last Second Save" of our protagonists, to the point I felt it was a running gag. This is especially true in the last dungeon, where you would expect that the protagonist would demonstrate their great growth through countless struggles, only to have to be saved oh so many times during key confrontations simply because their opponents can pull second winds out of their ass ...

- Falcom is too pushy with their favorite gril (Alisa).

- Too easy for a LOH game (Probably due to the possible game breaking mechanics that are readily available)... 

- As a follow up to the point immediately above, game Balancing issues ... Though I enjoy humiliating bosses, I should not be able to abuse them to the point they don't get even a single turn ... or to kill them in one blow even before their first phase ends (One Punch Laura set up)...

- Mech battles are kind of uninspiring ... I still find them fun, but they felt like a convoluted rock paper scissor game ..

- Game crashing occurences ...

- I was forced to grind for the 100 overdrive activation achievement ...

40682388.review:
闪2无论是剧情还是战斗，体验是真的差
先说战斗方面，本作的战斗很好的诠释了什么叫“闪”之轨迹，不是你秒怪就是怪秒你。像我这种喜欢打消耗战的玩家来说体验非常不友好，你想打消耗战？对不起，boss会各种奶自己，各种给自己加buff，更恶心的是一次奶就算了，还使劲奶自己，你不一刀秒根本玩不下去。
关于骑神战我就不多说了，系统非常简陋，感觉是没做好赶工赶出来的。
新增的战斗系统——增幅强化，基本就是精简版的爆灵。这个战斗系统还是挺有用的，前期boss战必用，后期里一刀上线后就少用了。不过闪2多了个失落魔法，在里一刀秒不掉对面的情况下，开强化配合各种失落魔法还是很稳的。

闪2的最大缺陷恰恰是rpg游戏最看重的剧情，完全没有之前轨迹系列的剧情水准。那么闪2的剧情到底问题出在哪里呢：
[h1]战争描写不足，甚至可以说完全没有[/h1]
闪2的剧情是帝国内战，按理说应该是闪轨系列的一个高潮，但是法老控对于战斗场面的描写非常少，基本上只有零星的装甲兵团会战。在7班攻城略地的过程中，除了一个大集市被烧了之外，毫无战争气氛，大城市基本能完好无损地保存下来，全程也就死了两三个重要人物。

[h1]战争双方的立场[/h1]
很多人都有这种感觉：嘴上说着自己是第三阵风，不干涉内战，实际却怎么都像是正规军的敌后小分队。这就是法老控自己对剧本中战争双方的定位有问题，而且是本作剧情中最大的问题。内战中的战争双方都是谁？贵族派和正规军，那么改革派呢？excuse me？难道不是贵族派和改革派的战争么？改革派势力，除了铁路宪兵队，完全没在整个内战中出现过。其实这场战争都是贵族派和正规军在打，那么以凯恩公爵为首的贵族派的目的就不是单纯的打倒改革派那么简单了，而是要推翻皇帝的统治，自己上位统治帝国。7班众的第三阵风实际上是名副其实的，既不站贵族派，也不站改革派[spoiler]毕竟内战开始前都倒台了嘛233，[/spoiler]，而是以自己的意志行动，最后的胜利果实却被宰相窃取了。但是闪2的剧情一直支支掩掩地，就是不明确告诉你这些，结果就是这样了。

[h1]拖沓而空洞的剧情[/h1]
作为轨迹系列的高潮，闪2的剧情不应该是这样啊。整个内战持续两个月结束，而闪2从战争开始一个月后开始，也就是从序章到终章，一共过了一个月。但是在这一个月里，除了找同学和收复失地，基本没什么内容。探索→收复失地→休息日→探索，一直重复着这样的模式，显然这样的剧情严重注水，没有任何想玩下去的欲望。好不容易到了终章，把最终boss打完，却发现整个内战根本没讲清楚很多事，就这样草草结束了。要不是后面有外传和后日谈，闪2就干脆不要剧情了。

其他的缺点，诸如七班对克洛的感情，后宫角色对里爷的感情，我也就不说了，毕竟玩过的人都知道有多大槽点。玩完之后也没觉得很失望，毕竟一开始我对闪2的期待非常低。最后这个好评是给xseed的优化。
[spoiler]没有闪3玩我要死了[/spoiler]

40618244.review:
[b]“之前一直听说闪2很辣鸡，然后我抱着玩辣鸡的心态去玩，却发现它没那么地辣鸡。”——来自网易云音乐用户“Aqours阿库娅”的评论[/b]

我的感受也和这位朋友一样，期待值不高的话，是可以从闪2中获得很不错的体验的。包括广大玩家诟病的剧情部分，亮点仍然可圈可点。所以，要说闪2是完全的失败作，是有失偏颇的。下面的评测重点探讨剧情问题，微剧透。

[h1]剧情跑偏了？写残了？并不是这样。[/h1]

很多玩家指出，闪2的剧本很失败。确实，整体上看，闪2的剧情可以说是历代最差了。不过静下心来深究问题所在，我发现了其症结并不是如大家想象的那样，事实更像是：

[h1]闪2的剧情，“根”没问题，长出来”枝叶“有问题。[/h1]

通俗地说，就是剧情的主线是没太大问题的，问题出在文本的质量上。很多玩家指出，主线太莫名其妙了，用大量的篇幅来描写找同学的过程，干涉帝国内战也如过家家一般儿戏。最开始我也觉得扯淡，但是后来一想，闪2的主题大概就是这样——在迷茫中寻找出路。毕竟主角一行人只是不谙世事的学生而已，需要不断进行意义不明地历练嘛。就像OP的第一句歌词一样，“不知该做怎样的梦，就连绝望都被剥夺”。如果说仅凭七班那群人，就能直接有效地干涉内战，搞很多大新闻，反而给人一种不真实的感觉。所以，对于我个人来说，闪2的主线虽谈不上精彩，却还“尚可”，处于可接受的范围。

另一方面，要喷闪2的主线，某种程度上就是在喷空之轨迹SC的主线。老玩家都能发现，实际上闪2的剧情发展走向基本就是SC的套路，连一些关键角色的人设也几乎照搬了。从这一角度讲，闪2的原创度可以说极差。但是抛开原创度不说，空轨SC的模式，如果借鉴得好，确实能再次带来感人至深的效果。然而这次山寨的效果呢？问题是一抓一大把了，具体如下：

1.铺垫不够，导致感人的桥段略显做作。剧情的很多桥段，那真叫一个“迷之感动”。某两个角色之间，明明话都没说几句，以现实的眼光看来，完全就是点头之交。居然会因为某个简单的事件，忽然感慨人生，感悟友谊之坚定，纷纷作下山盟海誓，说一堆肺腑之言。这种感觉真的很扯淡啊，就算你们心意相通，这只是一个游戏啊，玩家需要通过对话来认识你们的这种默契，不是靠突兀的煽情来骗眼泪的。让我印象最深刻的设定就是攻略人物，尤其是部分女角色，尼玛就触发了几次不痛不痒的羁绊事件，居然就和黎恩恋爱了？！。。。我感觉我的情商受到了侮辱

2.文本不耐看，值得咀嚼回味的台词基本没有。一个直观的体会，空轨的文本像是研究生写的，零碧是本科生，而到了闪轨，我就感觉这文本真像是高中生写的。我们可以发现，闪2的台词基本是日常对话的程度，如果以学习日语来说，看不懂空轨日语的童鞋，看闪轨日语大概是会轻松一点的。举个例子，当发生感人桥段的时候，主角一行人总会有几个说“唉，这时候，真不知道说什么了”。嗯，确实看得出来，写文本的员工墨水干了。总之，在闪2里面，我很少能看到像前作那样朗朗上口的经典台词，比如“要守护就守护到底，要放弃就不要回头。”个人认为其原因之一就在于，闪轨系列缺乏“哲理性”的人设，如老卡、莱维这样的。闪轨的人设大多是照顾死宅的模式化形象，Prprpr后就扔了的那种，希望在续作中能有所改进吧。

3.轨迹系列剧情的缺点，在闪2中被放大了。相信老玩家又有体会了，其实闪2的剧情模式还是妥妥的falcom风格，还是熟悉的套路，只是原有的缺点被放大了。比如一些偏低龄的，或者俗套的剧情，你敢说从闪2才开始出现么？不是这样的，很多硬伤甚至从空轨就有了，只是被空轨的优点掩盖下去了而已。而闪2由于缺乏过硬的剧情，很多缺点就变得明显。所以，闪2剧情的问题并不在于“没写出好剧情”，而是“玩剧情套路的熟练度下降了”。如果还是如此故步自封，延用以前的老模式，那么后续作品受众就会越来越向品味低级的玩家靠拢。

说了这三个最明显的缺点，下面说说剧情上的优点。很多玩家认为，前期还行，终章一口屎。我不这么认为，我觉得终章还是很不错的。大家喷的一些槽点并不是很客观，比如某人是宰相亲儿子，很多人说这太雷人了，是为了震撼而震撼。我觉得还好啊，不这么雷人，某人也不至于性情大变嘛，作为铺垫来说，还是可以接受的。并且终章高能也是有的，比如一哥和某人单挑，还有最后的双人合作机甲战，挺燃的。所以还是那句老话，闪2主线并不差，而是干货太少，补充在主线当中的具体剧情太水。就好比作文提纲还行，却没有认真地去夯实和完善它。

[h1]最后说说闪2的其它优点，这些优点足以让你购买这款游戏：[/h1]

1.战斗爽快度提升了，延用了一些碧轨的战斗系统，对战斗的流畅度也作了一定优化，加上一些新的魔法和战技，打起来大呼过瘾，我是渣渣辉.jpg。只是问题在于，爽是爽了，策略性明显下降，本作战斗就是“堆伤害”，后期黎爷一人砍爆一切，不过噩梦难度可以一定程度地平衡这一点。

2.本作的收集要素极其丰富。换句话说，收集要素差不多是闪2的本体了，大量的信息等着你去探索收集，收集癖玩家的天堂。即使到了二周目，也有限定的收集要素和剧情。

3.外传良心。大家的关注点都在3D莉夏上，没人强调克洛斯贝尔也被等比重制了吗？

4.结局有推陈出新之兆。为什么你们都说闪2结局虐，还带有贬义呢？我觉得对比以往作品的结局，闪2的结局已经有一些突破了，以一种未知、茫然、落寞的气氛结束。挺好的呀！一个故事，要往有深度的方向走，就必须灌注一些负面情绪。总是像以前那样乐观，皆大欢喜收场，未必是最好的结局。

[h1]总结：[/h1]

客观来说，闪2历代最差是跑不掉了。不过个人认为，“历代最差”有其不可忽略的积极意义。破而后立嘛，尤其对于一个游戏系列来说，最差的一代往往是个好兆头。闪3虽然风评不佳，但已经有进步的趋势了。只是伴随着falcom越来越有钱，游戏的商业化特征也会越来越强。续作的好玩度大概会节节攀升，至于这剧情深度，我就抱着不太乐观的态度拭目以待吧。

40605535.review:
ストーリー主体のRPG、閃の軌跡の2作目です。イージーモードでクリアしてのレビューです。

このゲームは2014年にPS3とPSVITAで発売されたゲームのPC移植版です。ただし音声が英語になっています。ゲーム開始直後に流れる前作の回想シーンやボス戦での戦闘開始時のセリフなど、一部ですが重要と思えるシーンで字幕がなく英語音声だけがながれる部分があります。また、新しい地域を訪れたときの地名表示やゲーム終了時のメッセージなど、前作では日本語表記されていた部分の一部が英語表記になっています。インタフェースや会話メッセージなどは日本語で表示されるため、細かいところを気にしなければ最後まで問題なく遊べると思います。前作同様オープニングや人物紹介的なシーンなどで日本の声優の名前が表示されますが、残念ながら表示だけのようです。オープニングなどで流れる歌は日本語でした。

物語は完全に前作の続きで、内戦によってばらばらになった仲間たちを集めて居場所を取り戻していく物語になっています。今回はロボットもののテレビアニメを1話ずつ見ているような感じで話が進行します。良くも悪くも、既存の人気アニメなどの要素をふんだんに取り入れた作りになっていて、どこかで見たことがあるようなキャラクタの設定やセリフ回しなども多く出てきます。このあたりは賛否がわかれるかもしれません。ストーリー的にはこの地域での物語りは今後もまだまだ続くようですが、主人公たちの学生生活の物語としては決着がついて話が閉じる形で終わります。

新たな要素として、戦闘システムにオーバードライブというピンチから脱する助けになる仕組みが導入され、中盤の移動システムに様々な乗り物を駆使して国内のいろいろな地域を移動できる仕組みが導入されています。一度おとずれた場所に再度行けるのはいいですが、サブクエストにいろいろな地域をまわるものがあり、お使い感が増しているのが少し残念でした。それから、現時点ではゲーム自体が少し不安定で、途中で落ちることが数回ありました。こまめにセーブをしておいた方がいいと思います（2018/3/6現在）。

今回もターボモードが利用可能で、弱い敵との戦闘シーンやカメラがゆっくりパンするだけのイベントシーンなどを高速化できて便利です。このモードはコントローラーの右スティック押し込みに割り当てられていてそのままでは操作しにくいですが、今作では設定でコントローラーのボタンの入れ替えが可能になったので、右トリガの機能と入れ替えることで前作同様の感覚でのプレイが可能です。ただし、同じ機能を複数のボタンに割り当てると意図しない動作になることがあるので、全てのボタンに別の機能が設定されるように「入れ替え」をする必要があります。

外部ツール(tridefなど)を使って3D立体視で遊べます。ただし、立体視にすると動作がさらに不安定になるので、セーブしながらひととおりゲームをプレイした後で、立体視で見たいシーンだけをロードして視聴するのが良いと思います。

前作同様、リアル志向とは全く逆のアプローチをしているゲームでアニメ的な要素がかなり強いので、そういう雰囲気が苦手な人には向かないと思います。
物語としては、いちおうの決着はつくので、前作をプレイして楽しめた人に特にオススメします。

The first game had deliberately slow pacing, which gave time for the characters to develop in meaningful ways. The pacing of Trails of Cold 2 is just all over the place. Nothing of consequence will happen for ten hours, and then five major things will happen all at once with no warning.  While all of the pieces of a great story are here, it just isn't told at the same level of efficacy as the first game in the series. I'm still interested to see where the story goes in the next installment, but nowhere near the same level as I was when I finished the first installment.

40406119.review:
[Warning - this review will contain spoilers for Cold Steel I]

Six months after the release of the first game on Steam, and we already have a high-quality Durante port for the second. Class VII is back in business.

The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel II is a turn-based JRPG that is a direct sequel to the first Trails of Cold Steel. The game once again focuses around Rean Schwarzer and his friends in Class VII as they struggle against the realities of [spoiler]the sudden civil war that erupted in Heimdallr between the Noble Alliance and the Imperial Army. As the class is separated in the ensuing chaos after the events in Heimdallr, Rean goes on a journey to find his friends and reunite Class VII, while also finding a way to end the war between the social classes.[/spoiler]

As a word of warning, the game takes place at the same time as Trails to Zero and Trails to Azure (Zero no Kiseki/Ao no Kiseki) and they will spoil each other. These two games (referred to as the Crossbell duology) are not yet fully localized, so you may be left with more than a little curiosity about the happenings in Erebonia's defiant neighbor.

The gameplay is very similar to that of the first Trails of Cold Steel, which is a traditional turn-based combat with a party of four. However, it's been tweaked a bit from the first game. A lot of game-breaking strategies were somewhat nerfed (but most still remain game-breaking), and a new mechanic has been added in the form of Overdrive. Activating Overdrive with a linked partner allows them both to instantly take the next three turns (the overdrive activator taking two and the partner taking one), as well as granting an instant HP, EP, and CP boost. All attacks made during this overdrive period are guaranteed critical hits, and arts have no casting time, which allows for some creative combinations to secure a victory or turn a losing battle around. Notably, the [spoiler]Divine Knight battles[/spoiler] from CSI have a much more prominent role in the second game. So, as such, you can expect to see a good amount of the [spoiler]Ashen Knight [/spoiler] in action.

The "bonding" system from CSI is back, as well. On "rest days" (as opposed to free days in CSI) you can see bonding events with certain characters to increase their link levels. However, the array of characters in your party and that you can bond with is quite a bit bigger than CSI's roster, and there are a number of guest characters that take up arms and join Class VII in their efforts to [spoiler]stop the civil war.[/spoiler]

Another improvement is the amount of freedom you have to move around. A common complaint about CSI was that it was far too linear - CSII fixes that by taking a rather nonlinear approach to its second half, with the player having a very large amount of liberty to go where you please. A lot of interesting things are happening all over the country during the war, after all.

As always, Falcom's music is top-notch. Borrowing from the best of Cold Steel and playing new tracks in just the right moments, CSII does not disappoint on the audio front. Visually, the game also exceeds Cold Steel I in that it showcases a number of new gorgeous locations (such as the town of Ymir). In general, most of the strong points of CSI were made even stronger in CSII - however, in my opinion, something else suffered with it.

One of CSII's biggest flaws, in my opinion, is the somewhat inconsistent character development in comparison to other Trails games. There are a number of times in which the characters' actions and motivations have little logical sense, and sometimes their actions contradict the reasoning behind them. I can think, off the top of my head, at least five instances where this took place. The characters are still overall well-written in comparison to other JRPGs, but for a Trails game, it's somewhat off-putting. Most of the characters that were good in the previous games remain at a high quality for writing, but there were more than a few questionable decisions made by the characters that didn't really correlate with their goals, which had a negative impact on the story.

Despite my reservations on this front, I would highly recommend CSII, as it is still a Trails title - meaning it remains a quality game. Even the weaker Trails games are still excellent in their own right, and the entertainment you get from the game is well worth its price tag. This series is a must for any fan of JRPGs. 

Towa's still the best, as well - but she may have competition from a black rabbit and a blonde princess this time around.

I played this game so much... I want to do NG+ of both games. Now I am just yearning for CS3 to be on PC because of how much I loved these games. The character development is superb and the story is incredible, but the combat system is something that I had been missing since the masterpiece that is Grandia 2. 

I would also like to talk about the 'Turbo Mode' which you can easily set to a controller button and use whenever you please whilst playing the game. Do you wish that you could speed up the running back and forth to diffrent locations, movement animations and dramatic pauses in some games? The super cool spell animations / cutscenes are great during epic as hell boss battles and taking revenge on the big baddy with a fully powered up super attack, they really are. But be honest with yourself, whilst grinding you really wish you could just speed that stuff up. Its a much welcomed and needed game mechanic that should be in any and every adaptation of story drived JRPG's. Now the 'Turbo Mode' is in no way cheating at all. You don't hit harder or get super everything, it is just speeding up the game. Thats all it does. If I could play Golden Sun 1 and 2 with these features I would beat them multiple times a year because of how much I love them. My play time for the Trails games shows around 45ish hours, but my in game time is well above 80 hours. To be able to enjoy these games and get the full experience while just speeding through the unnecessary, lengthy camera panning is a godsend. 

tl;dr
The game is absolutely fantastic in both gameplay and story, and the 'Turbo Mode' should be a staple for every JRPG.

40362196.review:
This is a hard game to review.  Not because it is a bad game (it is, in fact, excellent in so very many regards), but because as a direct sequel to a game as big as Trails of Cold Steel, your impressions of it will largely be predicated on your feelings for CS1.  Needless to say, jumping in mid-arc in any Trails/Kiseki series is ill-advised, [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/538680/The_Legend_of_Heroes_Trails_of_Cold_Steel/]so go play the first one[/url] before considering picking this up.  If you enjoyed it, you're going to want to play this one.  If you didn't, CS2 is unlikely to greatly sway your opinion of this story arc.

Still here?  With that out of the way, you might ask how CS2 fares as a sequel to CS1, and the answer would be that it is an improvement in most regards.  The pacing is significantly faster as the story shifts into a higher gear and the stakes are raised for all the characters involved.  If you loved them before, you'll continue to love them here, as their characterization hasn't changed enormously.  A big change however in CS2 is the large number of guest party members, who come and go with enough frequency that it keeps things fresh outside of the now-familiar members of class VII.

On the whole, polish is much higher in CS2, with animation improvements being the major standout from the often utilitarian ones in CS1.  Considering that CS1 was Falcom's first fully-3D game, that jump isn't too surprising, but it is very nice to see.  Structurally, the game is mostly similar to the original, but eventually opens up into large non-linear sections where you have free access to most of the game world.  If you have any nostalgia for Final Fantasy VI and VII, you'll definitely appreciate these sections.

The only final thing to keep in mind for CS2 is that it is [b]not[/b] going to deliver you the kind of closure you got in Trails in the Sky SC.  This is the second part of a four part story, and while it doesn't end on a cliffhanger like CS1 did, you absolutely will be left with more questions than answers.  As long as you go in with that understanding, you'll doubtlessly have a great time.

Highly recommended.

Hardly anything feels bloated and you can skip through most things if they start getting stale.

For me, these trails games are literally the highest criteria I use to judge all other JRPGs. Every one of these games I've played so far are absolute masterpieces and this one is no exception. This series, in my opinion, truely deserves their title as Legends.

40311301.review:
Was honestly really surprised this not only lived up to expectations, it surpassed them. I mentioned in my reviews of the other Trails games that while these games aren't perfect, every mechanic is at the very least solid, and every iteration always manages to expand upon it, but again the true star of this series is the characters. 
The new introduced characters, the interaction and depth is something you rarely if ever see in games, and it truly shines in this game. 
The combat is improved, the maps and layout are still largely linear, but there are more branching paths and even some optional areas so even that's a pretty big improvement in my book. Even the combat that was teased at the end of CS1 is massively expanded and improved. The series has so far made it to my favorite game series of all time, and it's proven it can keep that title. I'd definitely give the Worldbuilding and Character Development of this series a perfect 10.

40305057.review:
Maybe i don't need to write this obvious statement, but why not: you MUST play at the very least Cold Steel 1 before playing this. And better, play the rest of trails series before or later ( sky trilogy, zero, azure ) 

(+)
- Great soundtrack ( again! )
- Interesting character interaction, NPC, world building.
- Detailed NPC dialogue. I mean I already playing a bunch of JRPG before and while not all, there are MANY JRPG that too lazy to fill the NPCs dialogue ( like they didn't change the dialogue for looooooooong time, unrelated/inappropriate/too stiff dialogue etc etc, ). Cold steel ( and ofc the rest of the series ) is one of the best NPC dialogue i have ever experienced.
- More freedom for exploration
- built-in frame skip
- Bonding event for more character interaction
- more playable character = wider party build
- gundam battle is more fun and balanced 
- you can customize towa!1!1!

(-)
- While you think they balanced some of the previous game battle system ( like accuracy is now not ignorable, evasion tank is less broken ), they actually make the battle setup is much more abuseable ( and you can easily build it ). AT delay spam, OP back-to-back S-craft damage, ( too ) huge boss damage output, basically if you didn't setting up your party to the point of abusing certain feature, your party will be wiped out in a few turn of them. overdrive, good ol' noble command buff and backtoback chrono burst, etc etc. heck, even many of their single craft is broken enough by itself. If you want a little challenge, you should probably set your own rule at your setup.

for now, i'll leave the score as 8.5/10. Overall it is better than cold steel 1. The biggest letdown is probably the much more broken battle setup, but I still really enjoy the game. Might change/add more review after I finished my first playthrough

40303193.review:
作为法老控的轨迹迷，在发布的第一时间购入了作品并且通关。简单说一下通关感想：

画面：
游戏把画质开到头比主机要好上一大截，唯一的小伤的是人物不会动的眼睛(好在听说三代已经做出了改进)。

内容：
和闪1PC一样追加了一些新的对话。英语语音这次听起来比上一作自然许多了，不过还是更期待主机版的日文语音。游戏各种场景加载速度与闪1相比有一定的提升，同时还加入了对SSD的优化。此外，闪2的continue from last save功能大幅缩短了游戏启动时间。但是游戏仍然存在着比较大的缺点。使用机械硬盘游玩的情况下，闪1一直开6倍turbo放动画，如果动画间需要读取新资源的时候，人物就卡住不断地重复摇晃动画，松开turbo让游戏读取一会儿才能继续进行。这一现象并没能在闪2进行修复。

剧情：
当初在主机发布时传闻因为赶工和容量限制两个原因，把本来的帝国篇强行做成了帝国东部篇。游戏内容有较大的缩水。这导致了整个游戏情节显得相当的生硬，很多地方都是由游戏人物强行交代叙述，故事主线略短而且并不饱满。而且不得不吐槽的是闪1的关键时刻必有人救场的老套情节在闪2更加严重了，这绝对是对激发玩家主线情节的兴趣与感触有害无益的。而且系列遵循了结局揭示身边某正能量饱满的人一定是大反派的老套路。实在是看都看腻了，希望falcom出一些新意。可以赞赏的是本部中对于黎恩的身世交代这个坑倒是挺不错。

最后作为轨迹粉，衷心祝福待法老控塑造的塞姆利亚大陆愈加完善！

40258887.review:
作为一名轨迹西系列PC版的老玩家，能在PC上玩到闪轨2实属不易。于是不想单一对本作写评测，而是对整个系列写一篇吧。
其实当年玩《空轨1》的时候，一直到通关都觉得是流水账，心想：“唉这游戏讲的啥啊~”，直到结尾小约喂艾丝蒂尔喝完口水后戛然而止，才激动起来：“卧槽这特么啥情况？后面怎么了？咋特么突然结束了？”  于是跑去啃2代日文版。等2代中文版出了又去啃3代日文版。
感觉这游戏的性质是：1代交代世界观（开端发展），2代开始精彩（高潮结局），3代开始炒冷饭（老地图拿回来重新编剧情）的节奏。
为什么坚持这个系列？因为那个年代有两个画面比较类似的游戏，一个是《RO》，还有一个是《星尘物语》。
于是《碧轨》坑也入了，这一作虽然没有空轨古代文明那么魔幻，但故事情节也有开端发展高潮结局，而也是从这一作起，轨迹开始走上了后宫路线。。。
回过头来看《闪轨1》《闪轨2》
首先摒弃了Q版造型，可能有人要问为啥啊？因为当年玩空轨的小孩子现在都长大了，你们需要的不是Q版而是大长腿~~
下面来综合说说本作还有啥卖点？
剑与魔法的宏大世界观，活动于历史的巨浪中                                                            1/10
塑造了各种个性分明富有魅力的角色，包括反派在内               2/10
开启后宫模式：耿直傲娇loli御姐应有尽有                    3/10
音乐好评             4/10
你们喜欢大舰巨炮？没问题，《空轨2》都出到战列舰了         5/10
战舰还不过瘾？送你高达要不要                                              6/10
玩法多样，打牌钓鱼料理小说情报手记                                                  7/10
导力器玩法改变，早就已经不是当年堆属性出魔法了，当年公主王子一条线走到黑的导力器是最NB的，现在却变成最鸡肋的，副班长那种一炮下去各种牙各种刃的反而逆转了                                                                              8/10
伤害变的更逆天，强力回路的出现使一刀999成为可能，失落魔法的出现使玩法上多了堆魔攻的选择，甚至可以后备队员装配失落魔法，上来放一轮就回去休息                      9/10
2代可以推公主了                                                                  10/10
我编不下去了，谁来救救我~

40216111.review:
Bought this Day 1 on steam , no questions asked! This is a jaw dropping sequel to an already amazing game and an equally superb PC port. XSEED and Durante knock the ball out of the park once again making NISA (localizing YSVIII) look chumps in the process.

I played ~20 hours on my PS3 and when I heard the PC announcement I immediately stopped, waiting to play it on the definitive platfrom. And believe me , it IS definitive!

Right off the bat, similar to CS1 you are treated to an amazing launcher which shows via screenshots what each graphical option does, so its easy to tweak your settings according to your specifications.

There's also a 'continue from last save' option when you hit the Play button from your library, allowing you to directly jump in your last save without opening the game and main menu and such. An option I never knew I wanted and now I think should be made for every PC game! :D

Turbo mode is back, you can fast forward cutscenes and battles (wouldnt recommend the former unless you are on NG+).

Wont go too much in the story cuz spoilers, but its a direct sequel to CS1 so you definitely have to play that one first. However this game does a pretty great job in summarizing the events of CS1. There's a detailed summary under 'Memories'  tab on the main menu.

You can import your CS1 clear save data which gets you extra items like the casual clothes dlc if you bought them for the first game. Importing your save also means your character will recognize some people he met and dialog will be changed. Also your waifu will also be carried over , hue. (I got Alisa and Sara in 2 separate save slots :P )

Also if you have any prior Trails in the Sky  game in your library you get Estelle and Joshua's dlc outfits for Alisa and Rean respectively  for free!

So yeah! Long story short, if you ended CS1 buy this ASAP, if you didnt end CS1 , buy this ASAP and end CS1 before starting this. You wont be dissapointed.
11/10 all the way!

EDIT: Clocked in my first playthrough at ~70 hours. As the curtains fell, i realized that we are only halfway through the Cold Steel saga. Hope CS3 gets localized soon too.

長時間のボス戦が終わった直後にバグって強制終了します。

このゲームのプレーは、おすすめできません。

-----------------------------------------------------------

ver1.2 になってマップ移動時、戦闘時のロード時間が大きく短縮されました。

戦闘中の表記、「move」が「移動」と書き換えられるなど、日本語表示される箇所も少し増えたようです。

バグがどうなったかは確認してません。

元々製作時間が短かったようで、ストーリーやシステムに粗さを感じたりもしますが、
全体的にはいいと思います。

－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－－

以下、ver1.1のときの感想。

前作のsteam版よりもエンカウント時のロード時間が長いと感じます。

いくつかのバグを見ました。

40156628.review:
タイトル通り、閃の軌跡の続編です。
少なくとも現在のVer1.2ではテキストは日本語対応ですが画像、たとえば説明文や画像マップ、UIの一部(釣りや料理のあるタブ名、右側の項目名など)が英語のままだったり、
コンシューマーにない部分のゲーム終了アイコンがなかったり、そもそも英語だったりと日本語対応が完全ではありません。
というかなんか未完成品とすら思えてしまう中途半端な感じがします。ベタ移植と言われても仕方ないかもしれません。
日本語音声もありませんし日本語テキストがあるだけでもよしとするしかないでしょうね。

コントローラーでの1作目にあったターボモードのボタンがL3と変更となっており、いまいち使いにくいです。
L2/R2がゲーム本編でショートカットとして使われるいるせいでしょうが、ちゃんとsteam版としてその辺も統合して
ショートカット選択一覧にターボモードを入れてほしいところですね。MOD機能じゃないんですから。

そして２から始めるのはお勧めしません。話的に完全に１と２はセットとなっています。
２も一応日本語対応として出してくれただけでオススメとします。

40141970.review:
拿了全成就过来写测评，满满的感动
本人是铁杆的轨迹粉，更确切的说是法老控的骨灰级粉丝，从英传3白发魔女开始到所谓的英传8，也就是闪轨了，其中没有任何一部作品让我失望过，当然这部闪2也是一样。
首先因为是移植版，pc运行的流畅度上算是满分，我的渣渣电脑也能有不错的效果，不过在游戏过程中有许多的bug，有时候会莫名其妙的跳出（在悠米尔有很多bug），更新了1.2之后还是有这个问题，比较影响游戏体验，算是一个瑕疵吧。（小技巧：在跳出前最小化窗口然后等一会儿再把游戏点开大概率就没事了……具体原理不太清楚，如果有其他相同问题的可以试试）

然后是被普遍吐槽的剧情上：我还是想稍微为闪2说两句，把这部游戏单独摆出来谈剧情其实是不妥的，闪1和闪2算是一部作品，闪1铺垫人物和背景，闪2展开，把两部作品按一个整体来看的话还是不错的。当然作为轨迹的老粉丝与其他人一样，玩过前作空轨，零碧轨之后再来玩闪轨，会觉得这tm讲了个啥？不就是个校园故事么……世界观上其实两部作品只讲了帝国内战这么一点，轨迹的粉丝失望其实也是必然的。
不过反过来看，如果抛开前作不提，把闪1和闪2单独拿出来，其实是一部很优秀的（校园题材）作品，闪1刻画了Ⅶ班每个人物的性格和特点，实习过程中一边成长一边增进同学之间的友谊，闪2遇到帝国内战，Ⅶ班同学们四散后又重聚克服众多困难，最后各自奔向各自的道路。大家团聚在一起的时候越是经历挫折，越是感情深厚，分别的时候就越是不舍，相信不少人也在游戏的最后被感动到了吧。

最后从总体评价一下这款游戏：闪轨1+2这个系列作为之前没有接触过轨迹系列的玩家是一部很好的入门作，游戏中会时不时有一些前作的小插曲，如果有兴趣的玩家最好推荐把前作补一补就最好啦~ 作为一款RPG角色扮演游戏来说，角色的代入感很强，在游戏过程中很容易引起玩家的共鸣；其次人物建模很棒prprpr，BGM也是一如既往的好听（ps:闪2的结尾曲好好听！），地图刻画得也很细致，作为一款法老控的正统RPG可以拿90分了。


（烂的地方放最后说=。=）关于羁绊系统……感觉就是从日式GALGame里强行拿来用的。。。好处是战斗乐趣确实是提升了，但是吧……每个人的羁绊事件也太敷衍了点！尤其是最后的关键事件，几句话就没了？？！只有黎爷面无表情的告白和对方生硬的几句台词，完全get不到恋爱的感觉，二周目后看过每个角色最后几个事件之后你会发现对白除了少数几句几乎是一样的！毫无诚意，追了两部的女主最后几乎没有什么感情戏就结束了？？哎……一开始还期待二代能和大小姐深入一点结果就这么泡汤了TAT

脑子一热就写了这么多…闪3等出了汉化我就入，如果steam有移植就更好啦，还是那句话，敢出就敢买！

40140633.review:
It's certainly a modern game, and the graphics are better for modern gamers who cannot stomach 2D graphics like the ones in Trails in the Sky. The combat animations are faster which makes impatient gamers pleased.

But the story is arguably the weakest point. The usual cliche plot devices are spammed, the power level relations between characters went afk and you get to see characters who are considered to be inhumanly strong monsters fight against Class VII and the result is them feeling... exhausted like heavy smokers on a treadmill.

Tropes and cliches were always present but they just went overboard with them. The symbolical representation is weaker, alongside the direction.

It's a decent modern JRPG since we don't have anything worthy to compare it with on PC. Berseria I guess? Berseria's story and characters were so more intriguing and fleshed out, plus it doesn't require you to play two games to get an idea as to what's happening. 

I simply recommend this game for existing Trails fans because we're in too deep to be criticizing the game objectively so we show leniency to trope spamming, repetitive writing and flashy+fast yet abysmally balanced combat system. Personally, I enjoyed every Trails in the Sky game more than this, and if I were to take a guess I'm assuming that I will also enjoy the Crossbell duology whenever it comes out.

Who does it appeal to: Long-term Trails fans
Comfort levels: Casual

ALSO If you're going to include a difficulty level that's called NIGHTMARE you better make sure that the player will require to use everything AND the kitchen sink in order to stand a chance through it. Ys games and the old Trails in the Sky games have done that so much better. Cold Steel? Not so.

40130951.review:
I had trouble with rebinding the turbo key on my regular xbox one controller using the configuration tool, my workaround was to rebind the controller key itself. Here's how I did it:

1. Open Steam in big picture mode by pressing the controller looking icon in the top right of the steam window
2. Open Settings which is the cog icon in the top right > Controller Settings > Checked Xbox Configuration Support and Generic Gamepad Configuration Support on
3. Turned my controller off and on
4. Once the Controller is detected go Back > Back > Library > Recent tab on the left side > Trails of Cold Steel 2
5. On the left side go into Manage Game > Controller Configuration
6. I selected the left trigger on the top left, changed Full Pull Action to LS Click by clicking the picture of the left mousestick, and changed the trigger analog output to analog off
7. Select Done, then go into Controller Options and changed Use Steam Configuration for Non-Steam Controllers to Forced On > OK
8. Start the game and it should be working

40113305.review:
[b] TLDR: [/b] Regardless of your particular RPG Niche, this game and the one that came before is sure to satisfy all your story based RPG needs. The port is impeccable, brought to life with over 50 percent more voice acting than any other version by a group of people who are true fans of the series. Don't think, just buy. 


One of the best RPG (let alone JRPG) series of all time. It's devoted fanbase speaks for itself, but instead of talking about the game itself (which is, by pretty much any available standard, amazing) I would rather briefly touch on the group who have helped to localize and bring this amazing experiance to us.

Porting games the size and scale of these is no easy task, the sheer amount of content means that the project is unlikely to bring in much money, thus why these games have taken so long to reach US shores, and then again to reach us here in the PC Gaming community. 

Yet XSEED didn't port these games to make money, they ported them because they, too, are long time fans of the series and wanted to bring them to a new group of players who may not have been able to experiance them otherwise. 

You can feel their love and dedication to the games especially well in this port, everything they have added shows the love they hold for these games. From the Turbo feature, allowing you the choice to cut out any addition fluff and making something like grinding fly by as if an afterthought, all the way to the 50 percent additional voice acting, which true fans of the series were able to select their own important moments that they always wanted to see voice acted and make it a reality. 

This is all the more clear when you look at the amazing jobs done by the voice acters, and how well the behind the scenes process of choosing who to voice each character was done. English voice acting for JRPGs has historically been synonmous with the word "Cringe" however for Trails of Cold Steel NONE of the voice acters ever left me reeling or wishing for original japanese voice actors. 

On top of this, some characters, such as sharon, who have never before been voice acted in the english OR japanese versions of the game have found VA's who fit their personality so perfectly that you could never imagine them speaking with any other voice.

40110251.review:
One of the few JRPG series with an engaging, novel-like storytelling out there, especially if you are an anime fan. I've already finished this one and its prequel on PS3, but I'm ready to give both games another run. After all, I'm looking forward to the PC version of Cold Steel III! (to be released alonside the first episode of Final Fantasy VII Remake around 2048AD).

If you are looking for a game that has compelling characters, good story progression (which even affects the gameplay mechanics directly), a marked characted development and hour upon hours of gameplay for your money, look no further. Trails of Cold Steel (and The Legend of Heroes in general) tend to be heavy-story-focused JRPG games, so for us who are looking for something really worthwhile that will stay with you long after you've beaten the main storyline, this series is a heaven-sent.

Cons:
- You NEED to play the first Trails of Cold Steel to understand what's going on (though the game includes a summary of the story from the previous game alongside detailed character profiles).
- It's a very long game. No. Seriously. Say good-bye to your family!

40091083.review:
(Played 100+ hours in the Vita version previously)

This game is a direct story sequel which requires knowledge of the characters and events of the first game, Trails of Cold Steel 1. Given how good the original is, if you've played it to the end there's no way you won't want to buy Trails of Cold Steel II to see where the story goes.

If you haven't played the original Trails of Cold Steel, (CS1) there's no reason to buy this (yet). But really, go buy CS1, it's fantastic, then you can move on to this when you're done, because CS2 is also fantastic.

Regarding the PC version: I've only played it briefly so far, but everything about it looks and runs great from what I can see. This makes sense, given that it runs on the same engine as CS1, and was ported by the same person. CS1's PC port is widely considered one of the best JRPG console->PC ports ever made, and CS2 looks just as good. Buy with confidence.

Hopefully Cold Steel 3 and 4 will get english translations and quality PC ports. Please, XSeed?

40090571.review:
A continuation of Cold Steel I, Cold Steel II adds upon the classic Trails turn-based battle system with new legendary arts and overdrive mode. I have over 100 hours on the now-inferior PS3 version of the game and I can safely say that if you liked the previous installements in the series, you'll love this just as much if not more.

Note:

Newcomers to the series should start with Trails in the Sky: FC, SC and the 3rd. Then they can either play the current (horrible) fan-translated Zero no Kiseki or wait for The Geofront to finish making a proper translation. Guren is also in the process of translating and editing Ao no Kiseki, the direct sequel to Zero no Kiseki. Though, a popular alternative path that you can take is after playing through TitS FC, SC, and the 3rd, you can just jump straight to Cold Steel I and then of course Cold Steel II without a big deal. By skipping Zero and Ao, you're really not missing out on too much. It's not enough to detract from playing CSI and CSII at least. Cold Steel III is already out and can be imported from Japan but there is currently no knowledge on who will localize it and when it will become available for the western markets. Cold Steel IV is set to release later in Japan this year (est. September 2018).

40079676.review:
PS3のゲーム閃の軌跡2のいわゆるHDリマスター版です(ブーストモードあり)。
PS4でも今年に発売されますがこちらは8kFPS無制限まで対応してます。
グラフィック項目もかなり細かく設定できます。
日本語UI+英語音声という変わった仕様ですが、1同様音声ファイルが丸出しなので簡単に日本語音声を入れることができます。もしくは自分で作る事も可能です。
BGMファイルも丸出しなのでサントラ代わりにもなりますし、自分でカスタマイズとかもできてしまいます。

このゲームは1の続編です。
1が前編で2が後編のセットです。
PS4で発売した3と今年発売される4もセットとなっており、大きくわけて1と2(前編)、3と4(後編)という作りになってます。
一応ゲーム内で今までのストーリーを振り返れますが、正直1をプレイしないとほとんど楽しめません。
必ず1をプレイしてからやるべき続編です。

4k60FPS+Reshade導入でプレイしてみましたが、PS3とはくらべものにならないくらい綺麗な映像でした。
1のモーションが酷かったのですが、2になって微妙に修正されました。
個人的には2がすごく好きなのでsteamに登場した事に感謝してます。

空の軌跡のいずれかをダウンロードすると自動的にヨシュアとエステルの衣装がもらえるようです。

40079166.review:
The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel II

法老控下的英雄传说轨迹系列帝国篇第二部，闪之轨迹，也被叫做五十米拉物语。

对于我而言，本作优秀的我觉得只有个BGM了。

闪轨吐槽：

拖沓、相比利贝尔篇和克州篇的两部叙事（葱头算是番外篇吧）帝国篇长达4部（法老控官方消息，闪之轨迹4确定在18年秋季发售，是帝国终篇），帝国很大我理解，但是我觉得完全可以做成两部，你这样拆成4份，我滴妈，照这样下去，我估计玩到共和国篇和法典国篇，我都快入土了。

反派设定、本作的反派和结社登场成员感觉是搞笑来的，相比本作的结社成员设定，我更喜欢空轨里结社成员的设定，无论是莱维还是白面还是其他执行者。至于这作的反派前面还塑造蛮成功的，一到后面感觉就是在努力的逗我笑。角色初期形象设定一瞬间崩溃，反派各种洗白摇身一变变好人，铁血宰相我就不吐槽了，整整一个三流RPG里那种错的是这个世界的中二BOSS

主角一行人、角色边缘化严重，存在感低，存在感最低的要数枪哥了，闪1还好，到了后面我甚至不记得七班还有这个人

诈尸、（就不说是谁了）各种给自己加戏，麻烦加戏也请在什么隐藏结局里，蟹蟹，看看人家隔壁东京迷城。加戏都能让你哭的一塌涂地，你这个加戏加的我笑也不是哭也不是。

你问我为什么还要买？愚蠢！ 只要是轨迹系列，哪怕做成屎，我也吃给你看！

最后希望法老控好好对待轨迹系列这个IP，我不希望在共和国篇和法典国篇看到的还是闪轨这个样子的作品

40078882.review:
I've completed the game on PS3 and I'm now an owner of the PC version.

Expect the same great quality port from Durante. Config menu where you can change the graphic settings to just how you want, turn on turbo mode, and rebind keys/controller buttons. The new feature where you can boot the game to your latest save is very convenient.

I really can't say enough about how nice it is to play a game like this at 1080p resolution, 60 FPS, with higher quality assets and a wide FOV. 

As for the game itself, the Trails games tend to be like this: the first game in the series introduces the characters and the game world, and the second game massively expands on everything and refines some of the systems. TOCS 2 is no different. The story is longer, you can travel around the world at your leisure on an airship and recruit people, while still maintaing the excellent link system from the previous game (bonding with your team mates has a gameplay effect as well as story).

The cliffhanger from the previous game reaches a satisfactory conclusion - TOCS 2 really does end the story established in TOCS 1. So what is TOCS 3 I hear you ask? It simply continues the lives of these characters. I'm looking forward to it!

40078720.review:
Ben bu oyunu oynamadım. Evet, henüz oynamadım. Oynayacak mıyım? Elbette. Peki neden buradayım, neler yapıyorum ben böyle? Bazen kendime ben bile şaşırıyorum.

Aslında çok şaşılacak bir durum yok, ben bu oyunun birincisini bitirdim, ikincisi de %90 oranında aynı zaten. Dolayısı ile bu oyun hakkında yorum yapmak için bu oyunu oynamama gerek yok. Öyle de müthiş bir insanım.

Trails of Cold Steel II, ilk oyunun bittiği yerden devam ediyor dolayısı ile ilk oyunu bitirmeden buna geçiş yapmamanız sanki daha iyi olur. Olmayabilir de, bilemedim. Öyle de kararsız bir insanım.

Peki nedir efendim bu oyun? Falcom firmasının yaptığı bir JRPG oyunu elbette. Falcom bu alanda ilk 2-3 sırada gelen bir capon firması. Bu adamların işleri güçleri bu tarz oyunlar yapmak. Bunların oyunlarında, animelerde bulabileceğiniz tarzda karakterler, diyaloglar şart. Olmazsa olmaz. Sonracığma ortalama bir hikaye, uzun bir oynanış süresi ve iyi savaş sistemi muhakkak. Bu oyunda da onlar var. 50-60 saatinizi alacak bir oyun olacak. Öyle de öngörülü bir insanım.

Peki savaş sistemi nasıl? Güzel. Evet, güzel. Daha detaylı anlatmak gerekirse, çok güzel. Evet, çok güzel. Fakat turn based, yani gerçek zamanlı değil. Karakterlerinize "sen şunu yap, sen bunu yap" diyorsunuz, onlar sırayla yapıyor. Dolayısı ile "joysticki elime alayım, şılaps şılaps tuşlarına basayım, hayin düşmanlar ölsün" diyorsanız, demeyin. Öyle bir oyun arıyorsanız bunu almayın, üzülürsünüz. Öyle de düşünceli bir insanım.

Efenim hikaye dedik, karakter dedik, savaş dedik, bunların yanına yapılacak yan aktiviteler, bulunacak yeni silahlar, keşfedilecek mekanlar ve hoş müzikleri ekleyin, alın size Trails of Cold Steel II. Üstelik sudan ucuz. Sudan yani ucuz bir yermiş, ben öyle duydum. Gitmedim ama. Öyle de kültürlü bir insanım.

Bu tarz oyunlar çok gelmez, gelen de bu oyunun yayımcısı XSeed tarafından geliyor zaten. Alın, aldırın, güzel bir oyun. Öyle de güzel bir insan olun.

[h1][b]7/10[/b][/h1]

[h1]承上启下的及格之作？[/h1]

闪之轨迹1正统续作，虽然说成是闪1特大型资料片也不过分。延续上一部的剧情，加入了部分新系统，并对角色3D建模进行了细化。

距之前玩闪2已经有几年了吧，很高兴看到闪2顺利登陆steam，但也很无奈，自己并不是想通过PC版来重温作品，而纯粹是因为闪2实在是遗忘得差不多了，只好以这个方式来弥补空缺。
现在大概只能记得略显无厘头的结局，闷头刷瀑布霸道回路的日子，以及一首《Blue destination》保留在歌单里，啊还有3D化的莉夏。

要简单地说为什么令我印象不深，因为闪2实在是不够出彩。旨在描写帝国内战，但毫无气氛可言，穿插大量收集跑图等拖慢节奏的要素在主线中，造成整作剧情节奏极为怪诞。加上有些失衡的战斗系统，套路化展开的剧情（缺少标志性桥段），糟糕的3D动画演出以及刻画不力的人物角色，实在是没法给我留下深刻的印象……一定程度上，闪轨真的是靠优秀的2D原画和CV表现才撑住了场面，剧情有失法老控的一贯水准。
SC艾约空中相拥，零碧攻占兰花塔、罗爷越狱，只有诸如此类片段才能真正让人回味良久。

不过以上只是些牢骚，等闪2中文补丁出来还是会迫不及待地再玩几十个小时的（w

实测可以读取steam版闪轨1的通关存档领取继承奖励，打开游戏前也能在配置器里先进行详细的画面设置，帧数方面有60和无限制可选。
闪2这次不知道有没有新增文本，成就图标依然是重新绘制的，比闪1的可爱了很多，在此感谢业界良心XSEED~

最后催一遍NISA，再催一遍闪3，对它们依旧抱持着期待。

40077153.review:
Welcome to "The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel II" (ToCS II)

My review is based on my PS3 experiences (Cleared ToCS I and II twice), early PC insights and my personal opinion about this game. 

Trails of Cold Steels II:

-J-RPG 
-Turn-Based 
-Flexible skillsystem with a lot of strategy
-Not the hardest but really pleasant difficulty [Normal] 
(Go hard if you would like more of a challenge) 

-Story rich (Can drag on a bit at the beginning but it's getting really epic and interesting once you are hooked)
-It's quite linear but you have time to discover various places and towns (You have your freedoms) 
-No prior knowledge needed execpt ToCS I of course (but nothing from Trails in the Sky or the other titles - Just light references)

-Great and illustre characters and character development
-Motivating to deepen the bonds (Similar to Persona) 
-Almost every character (NPCs included) has his/her own story 

-A lot to do (amsuing sidequests, minigames, discovering and collecting various stuff)

-Average graphics in general
-A lot of love put into details, characters and environment 
-Graphics are still way better compared to PS3!
-A lot of improvements over the PS3 version like higher resolutions, higher frame rates (60 FPS), depth of field, shadows and so forth

-Really great OST which is underlining situations and the mood greatly (Still listening to them from time to time)

Playtime: Between at least 80 hours and 120+ (Average for my first time was around 110 - PS3)

-It's the second game of a trilogy/quadrilogy
-ToCS III will hopefully come to us later this year or 2019...

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

It's pretty difficult to recommend this to everyone depending on what you like...and if you have some experience from games like Trails in the Sky FC/SC/TC and Persona 

At best I would say it's a mix of the previous Trails in the Sky and "Persona" in general 

-It's a mix because like in Persona you have your everyday school life and mysterious battles/characters
-You are deepening your bonds with the "main characters" and getting to know their personality. This depends on the time you are giving each of them individually (Pretty similar to Persona)

The rest of the game is how you know it from Trails in the Sky 
-A lot of text-based conversations with spoken dialogues (way above average RPGs)
-A lot of details put into the story, the chraracters, background information and collectibles
-A lot of different things to do (next to the main story) like fishing, playing cards, quests and so forth 


+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

So who would I recommend it to?

=> People who liked the first game ;o)
=> People who like Persona and are into spending time to develop bonds with various characters
=> People who like to play turn-based games with deep strategy (You can abuse every system...)
=> People who are into longer games (Average time = 90-100+ hours)
=> People who are seaching for a great story where everything feels connected (Characters, Story, Backgrounds)
=> People who don't dislike certain clichés 

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

One of the best J-RPGs in recent years! ;o)

Осторожно спойлеры:
Первая часть Cold Steel - главный герой, простой школьник, учится и почему-то выполняет задания, на которых он обязательно сдохнет страшной смерти.
Вторая часть Cold Steel - главный герой, простой школьник, заработал отчисление, из-за смены руководства школы, и вступил в гражданскую войну, на которой он обязательно должен сдохнуть страшной смертью.
Третья часть Cold Steel - главный герой, теперь уже учитель, почему-то разрешает своим ученикам во время внеклассных занятий выполнять работу на которой они, опять же, обязаны сдохнуть страшной смертью.
Четвертная часть Cold Steel - главный герой черт знает где, черт знает что делает (потому что игра еще не вышла)
P.S.
